text:
Hi all! I'm hoping this lovely community can help me with an issue relating to the recording of "first page seen".
We are running HubSpot with our own consent banner on our Next.js frontend, with some custom code to record page changes. For some reason  "First page seen" is being recorded without url parameters, which means new traffic from paid ads do not have their traffic-source set to "paid search", making it impossible for our marketing team to provide accurate data on how effective our ad campaigns are.

Below is the code snippet for our HubSpot script implementation, which is integrated on the root app page.

(please let me know if this is the wrong place to post this, or in the wrong format)

Hi George. Thanks for pointing this issue out.
I believe Iâ€™ve fixed the root of the issue here.
Could you let me know if / when things start working as you expect?

Hello, is there a temporary fix I can implement to show `content.post_body|render` during proxy (it works fine published live). The issue seems to be a character breaking this comment:
```<!-- proxy local render of "@projects/theme-assets-project/app/components/modules/BlogStandardPost"
  {"request":{"contact":{"idType":null,"identi```
at some point, that starts to show:
```\n
content --
\n```
and the post ends with `"}}} end proxy local render -->`

it's the `<!--more-->` comment in the blog post that is breaking it. It's doing this:
```<!-- test comment 
<!-- more -->
ends here --> ```
that would print `ends here -->`
